intro: Pseudognaphalium thermale, commonly known as the hot spring everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert and semi-desert environments. Its small, showy yellow flowers bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant's ability to withstand harsh conditions makes it an important component of its native ecosystem.
